title: The Great Gatsby
description: A novel set in the Roaring Twenties.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A novel about racial injustice in the Deep South.
author: Harper Lee

description: A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale about the dangers of totalitarianism.
author: George Orwell

title: Brave New World
description: A dystopian novel set in a futuristic World State, where society is conditioned to be permanently happy.
author: Aldous Huxley

title: Moby Dick
description: A novel about the voyage of the whaling ship Pequod and its captain, Ahab, who is intent on finding the giant whale Moby Dick.
author: Herman Melville

title: War and Peace
description: A novel that chronicles the history of the French invasion of Russia and the impact of the Napoleonic era on Tsarist society.
author: Leo Tolstoy

title: The Catcher in the Rye
description: A novel about a teenager's experiences in New York City.
author: J.D. Salinger

title: The Road
description: A novel about a father and son's journey through a post-apocalyptic world.
author: Cormac McCarthy

title: The Hobbit
description: A fantasy novel about the adventures of Bilbo Baggins.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

title: Pride and Prejudice
description: A romantic novel that charts the emotional development of the protagonist Elizabeth Bennet.
author: Jane Austen

title: The Alchemist
description: A novel that tells the story of a young shepherd named Santiago and his journey to Egypt.
author: Paulo Coelho

title: Crime and Punishment
description: A novel about the mental anguish and moral dilemmas of an impoverished ex-student who kills a pawnbroker.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

title: The Brothers Karamazov
description: A novel about the existential struggles of three brothers.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

title: Ulysses
description: A modernist novel that chronicles the passage of Leopold Bloom through Dublin during an ordinary day.
author: James Joyce

title: The Divine Comedy
description: A long narrative poem about Dante's travels through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise.
author: Dante Alighieri
